name: Research and Records
summary: Explorations

hidden.content:

content.text:

choices.name: Use QUIKLinks, Partners, and GenealogyInTime to quickly search the most common record collections for Ireland.

content.text:
1. QUIKLinks are indicated by lightning-bolt icons in the Goals above.They point to collections with 50,000 or more records. When you click a QUIKLink icon, scroll down on the resulting page to see the QUIKLinks.
  2. In the Partners section (near the top of the page), explore additional record collections in FamilySearch, Ancestry, Findmypast and MyHeritage.
  3. Explore the FamilySearch page for Irish online record collections.
  4. Find genealogy websites for researching Irish ancestors.

    ☆ Best Websites for Researching Irish Ancestors

  5. Explore the Ireland and Wales page of the GenealogyInTime website. Record collections are listed and described in order from newest to oldest additions, including FamilySearch, Ancestry, and many other sources.

name: Get Help
section_name: Get help with your Irish research.

choices.name: Use Facebook pages to get answers to your questions.

content.text:
1. Visit the ☆Irish Genealogy page on Facebook.
  2. Visit the ☆Ireland: Genealogy and Heritage page on Facebook.
  3. Visit the ☆Ireland Genealogy! Just Ask! page on Facebook.
  4. Visit the ☆British Isles Genealogy Research Community on Facebook.
  5. See the Genealogy on Facebook list of Facebook groups dedicated to helping with research for Ireland.

choices.name: Join a mailing list or message board for Ireland research.

content.text:
1. Get free help with your Ireland research questions from members of the RootsChat forum.
  2. Explore the Irish research mailing lists available on Cyndi's List.
  3. Explore the ☆FamilySearch community for help with Irish research.
  4. Use the ☆Ancestry message boards to read or post questions about Ireland research.
  5. Explore Ireland research questions in the ☆Genealogy Stack Exchange.
